channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Experts say Auckland moving to alert level 3 is a risk - but PM says Covid-19 can be eliminated
item.description: Alert level 3 is being called a roll of the dice that could either eliminate Delta or send the country back into level 4.

item.title: Covid-19 wrap for 20 September: Auckland to leave alert level 4
item.description: Auckland to move down an alert level, 22 new community cases, the new MIQ booking system, the Waikato situation, the Māori King endorses the vaccines, and gang associates nabbed with a car load of KFC crossing the Tāmaki Makaurau border.

item.title: Remand prisoner likely infected en route to Firth of Thames residence
item.description: A prisoner who tested positive for Covid-19 was likely infected by someone who transported him to an address in the Waikato, the Director-General of Health says.

item.title: What you need to know: Updated alert levels for Auckland, Waikato, rest of NZ
item.description: The Delta outbreak in New Zealand has meant Covid-19 alert level restrictions are constantly being tweaked to keep the spread under control. Here's what they mean.

item.title: Ros Benson went from Simply The Best to looking after the rest ... of Picton
item.description: "If you sell your house, and I sell my boat, we could buy the leasehold on Furneaux Lodge," Ros Benson's partner said, after spotting a notice in the paper. The year was 1995.

item.title: 90 percent of High Court, Court of Appeal judges Pākehā
item.description: The High Court and Court of Appeal benches are dominated by white men, new figures obtained by RNZ show.

item.title: Revealed: Who is being discharged without conviction
item.description: A discharge without conviction can spare a person guilty of a crime years of struggle and stigma, but it's Pākehā who are being granted more each year.

item.title: Pākehā granted name suppression three times as often as Māori
item.description: An Auckland couple who breached lockdown to go to Wānaka have thrown name suppression into the spotlight. RNZ can now reveal startling statistics about suppression.

item.title: PM on Cabinet's alert level decision
item.description: Auckland will move to alert level 3 from 11.59pm on Tuesday night, and stay in level 3 for at least two weeks, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has announced.

item.title: Gang associates nabbed by cops on border run with cash and KFC
item.description: Police have arrested two gang associates they say were trying to get past Auckland's border on a back road, with a large quantity of cash and KFC.

item.title: Mandatory vaccination order under spotlight in High Court
item.description: An employment advocate has told the High Court the mandatory vaccination order made under the Covid-19 Public Health Response Act was unlawful and went over and above what the Act ever intended.

item.title: Tears and cheers as thousands miss spots in MIQ offering
item.description: There has been disappointment and frustration for the 22,000 New Zealanders trying to get home through the MIQ system who missed out on places this morning.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates for 20 September: 'Bespoke level 4' for northern Waikato
item.description: Part of northern Waikato has been issued a section 70 order, requiring people who live or work there to stay at home.

item.title: Strong winds force godwit migrating from Alaska to New Zealand to turn around
item.description: An unlucky godwit halfway through his migration from Alaska to New Zealand has turned back after hitting strong winds over the Pacific Ocean.

item.title: Covid-19: 22 new community cases as government to decide on alert levels
item.description: The Ministry of Health says 17 of today's 22 new community cases have been epidemiologically linked.

item.title: Driver who crashed car while fleeing police dies in hospital
item.description: Justice Grace, 21, of Waitara, died in Waikato Hospital on Sunday. He had crashed his car while fleeing police on 9 September.

item.title: NZ director of The Crown Jessica Hobbs wins Outstanding Director Emmy award
item.description: New Zealand director Jessica Hobbs has won an Emmy award for The Crown.

item.title: Hastings state housing project delayed by squeeze on construction supply chain
item.description: At least one state housing project has been delayed by the squeeze on the construction industry supply chain.
